comment: The class is not the most difficult thing in the world, but it is new and confusing material that she does a poor job of teaching. Her PowerPoints had zero content on them, it was all just problems that she would scramble through class. She gives very little feedback and pop quizzes at the turn of every corner. Overall, just not effective.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--BEWARE OF POP QUIZZES--GRADED BY FEW THINGS

comment: Great professor, very helpful and understandable with new ways of math. You should go to class in order to learn the new methods it builds into the next class. Quizzes were unannounced, but she always slightly told us when it would be.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.--BEWARE OF POP QUIZZES

comment: This class was not bad, but just felt unsure of myself the whole time. There is not a lot of feedback and the quiz and test felt really hard. I ended up with an A, so its not to bad. I just had to self-teach myself a lot. She is nice and cool, but seemed really busy and not focused on our class.  It was a lot of online reading to learn material

Dr. Head is one of the best professors I have ever had! She is so helpful, willing to stay after class and clarify anything you were confused about in class. The course matter is difficult to understand some times and she does her best to make it simple! You need to be prepared to read the posted documents and do the homework, but just try.

There is a ton of homework in this class. Most of the time it will on be a few problems (1-5) but each problem has 4-5 different parts to do. It's not hard, but very tedious to complete, especially since she doesn't always collect it.  Pop Quizzes are around every corner, and they're not always easy.  Be prepared.

Dr. Head can be very helpful if you ask. She started off with powerpoint notes which were very helpful. Then she started hand outs for notes and that confused me. When she started the handouts i felt like she didn't teach as much. She also allows you to do test corrections for half credit. She doesn't tell the students this so make sure you ask.

Dr. Head is super sweet and helpful! The class I took was from 5:00 to 7:45 once a week but we always got out early. Three tests including the final, one in October, one in November, and then the final in December. There is a group project but it is over easy stuff learned in class. All of the homework is on Webassign and the tests are from there.
